Class Event

  • java.lang.Object
    • Event
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Event>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArrivalEvent, BreakEvent, DoneEvent, ResumeEvent, ServeEvent, SwitchEvent

    abstract class Event
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Event>
    An abstract class that represents an event in the simulation. Each event has a time, representing the time at which this event occurs in the simulation time line. All concrete classes the inherit the Event class must implements run(), to customize how a specific event should be simulated by the simulator.

      • run

        public abstract Event[] run​(Shop shop)
        Abstract method that all subclasses must implement.
        Parameters:
        shop - The shop being simulated (containing servers and queues).
        Returns:
        An array of new events that are generated by this event.

        Return the time of this event.
        Returns:
        The time this event occurs in the simulation time line.

      • happensBefore

        public boolean happensBefore​(double time)
        Checks if this event happens before a given time.
        Parameters:
        time - The time bound to check against.
        Returns:
        true if this event happens before the given time, false otherwise.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(Event e)
        Define the natural ordering of events by their time. Earlier time is ordered before the later time.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Event>
        Parameters:
        e - Another event to compare against.
        Returns:
        0 if two time is equal, a positive number if the event has later time then e, a negative number otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Return a string representation of this event, in time form.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A formatted string of the time of this event.
